body.description: MDD (MD16TBGSA25672DVR) 16TB 256MB Cache 7200RPM SATA 6.0Gb/s 3.5" Internal Hard Drive designed for heavy duty 24/7 operation. It is perfect for Surveillance System, CCTV DVR & Desktop computers (PC/MAC). The MaxDigitalData 16TB hard drive provides an enormous 16TB capacity, 256MB Cache and 7200rpm rotation speed to deliver a greater level of power efficiency and quiet operation for energy-conscious, environmentally-friendly computers. 16TB of capacity to store up to 16,000 hours of HD video (depends on CCTV System.) Built for Surveillance system Heavy workloads? No problem. Smooth Video record & playback always Designed for heavy duty 24×7 operation

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.2 4.2 out of 5 stars 19 ratings 4.2 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Quality Hard Drive; Works As Well As More Expensive Brands
reviews.reviewText: This is my second MDD brand hard drive. I needed a large capacity hard drive on which I could clone the contents of a much older drive that was running out of space. This drive was available at roughly half the cost of competing drives, and since I had an excellent experience with an earlier, 10 Tb drive purchase for this same brand, I decided to take it.This drive arrived very sturdily packaged. It was well boxed and in a strong wrapper that protects the drive. The wrapper has a note on it suggesting that you format the drive after connecting it (use "Disk Management" in Microsoft Windows to do this.) The drive also came with a 3 year warranty card and a second card repeating the advice to format the drive after plugging it in to a Windows system. This is good advice for new purchasers who are not familiar with how to prepare a hard disk drive. Other brands of hard drives don't include such advice with their products. They assume you know what to do.Since cloning one hard drive to another is simply a bit-for-bit copy of an already formatted hard drive, I used the Gnu 'ddrescue' utility to do the cloning. I did not need to pre-format. This utility is available for Linux distributions. I did the cloning on a Linux computer, in other words. The cloning process went very well. Then I installed the drive on a Windows 11 Pro computer, and used the Windows 11 Disk Management utility to extend the volume so that the entire available volume would be recognized. Finally, I completed the installation process by running the Windows chkdsk utility on the new MDD drive to make sure there were no issues with the drive.This is an excellent quality, very tough drive. It is roughly half the cost of other drives. That is a very attractive price point.

reviews.reviewText: SYSTEM BACKUP much faster than older drives - 11 hr vers 2 days

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Runs great. Super price. Full drive
reviews.reviewText: I'm really happy with this drive. It's nearly 15tb. Installs fast. Works great. Amazing Price. I will buy another. Waiting for the 25tb drives. Lol

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent drive, superb price
reviews.reviewText: This is an enterprise level drive available at a surprisingly low price. My first drive worked so well I acquired 2 more for my my system to replace 2 very old 2TB NAS drives.Unraid pre-clears on all of the drives were flawless and installed in a modern case any potential extra noise from these drives is negated.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not great, not terrible
reviews.reviewText: Cheap, large capacity, noisy. Maybe these are refurbished Exos. But for that price it's worth buying two.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars So slow and so loud
reviews.reviewText: I bought two of these thinking I could back up all of my video and aerial imagery files. They are definitely large enough to back up my lifetime of work. However they are loud. And they're slow. I tried to defrag one of these drives two weeks ago and the defrag operation is still going. I can see where there are uses for drives this big, but i wouldn't make them my main storage for large file items like aerial photo tiffs and video files. On the upside I've been using the heck out of them and they have shown no signs of failure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's a good value.
reviews.reviewText: The drive arrived in perfect condition and I put it right to work as a backup volume. For the price, I could not be happier.
